name: Path T
title: Pathological T
notes:
**Note 1:**  TNM does not include a Tis or TX category for melanoma of mucosa of head and neck sites. Tis and TX are mapped to NA and TNM stage group is derived as NA.

**Note 2:**  TNM does not include a T1 or T2 category for mucosal melanoma of head and neck sites.

**Note 3:**  Assign T3 for extension involving the mucosa only of adjacent sites.  Assign T4a or T4b for extension involving the deeper tissues of the primary or adjacent sites.

**Note 4:**  Assign T3 for localized tumor when no other information is available.

**Note 5:**  The bones of the lateral wall of the nasal cavity include the maxilla, the perpendicular plate of the palatine bone, the medial pterygoid plate, the labyrinth and inferior concha of the ethmoid. The roof of the nasal cavity is formed by the nasal bone. The floor of the nasal cavity, which forms the roof of the mouth, is composed of the bones of the hard palate: the horizontal plate of the palatine bone posteriorly and the palatine process of the maxilla anteriorly.

**Note 6:**  "Bony invasion" does not include extension to palate, cribriform plate, or pterygoid plates.  Extension to these structures is coded separately.
rows:
In situ, intraepithelial, noninvasive

        Meatus (superior, middle, inferior) 
        Nasal conchae (superior, middle, inferior)
    Vestibule (edge of naris to mucocutaneous junction)

Confined to mucosa of nasal cavity, NOS 

Extension involving mucosa only:
    Ethmoid sinus
    Choana
    Frontal sinus
    Maxillary sinus
    Nasopharynx
   Sphenoid sinus

Localized, NOS

Tumor invades deep soft tissue, cartilage, bone
or overlying skin

Involvement of any structure in code T3 WITH bony invasion
Extending to adjacent connective tissue within the nasoethomoidal complex

Nasolacrimal duct

Tumor invades any of the following:

Dura
Skull base
